text: [Applause]
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hi I'm Sadie from AWS today I'll
demonstrate how to provision your echo
devices into your Alexa for business
account using our device setup tool
Alexa for business makes it easy to
manage echo devices at scale in order to
start deploying them we first need to
connect the devices to your Alexa for
business account so you can see them in
our management console you can log in to
Alexa for business from the main AWS
console in the productivity applications
category first log in to your Alexa for
business account and navigate to the
devices tab here you will see a set up
devices button they'll allow you to
download our device setup tool client
please note that the computer used for
provisioning must have Microsoft Windows
7 or later and cannot be a cloud-based
virtual desktop next we need to create
iam credentials to link your device
setup tool to your Alexa for business
account we recommend using AWS I am to
create a user meant only for the device
setup tool make sure you add the user to
an iam group with administrative
permissions you will use these
credentials to log into the device setup
tool when you are ready to begin
provisioning note that we only need to
complete this step the first time you
setup your devices first I'll go to the
I am service in your AWS console next
create a new policy specifically for
your Alexa for business device setup
tool click create policy after that go
to users click add user and call the
user 8 for beam setup tool make sure
that you select programmatic access as
the access type click Next
next attach existing policies directly
and you'll find the a for B setup tool
policy that you just created click
review and then finally create user be
sure to download the CSV file that
includes your access key and secret
access key these credentials will be put
into the device setup tool to align to
your Alexa for business account
great there are several tips for
repairing your devices before setup as
you unbox your devices label them with
at least the last three characters of
the device serial number printed on the
box dia signs are not printed on all
devices and clearly labeling them helps
you track them during setup and beyond
you can also create asset tags that have
the full DSN and bar code on the label
devices stay in setup mode for only 30
minutes and it takes about one minute to
set up each device to ensure that all of
your devices remain in setup mode for
this 30 minute window keep the power
strips off as you plug in your devices
turn them on when you are ready to run
the device setup tool if it's the first
time the devices have been turned on
they will automatically enter setup mode
otherwise hold down the action button on
the device for 8 seconds as you can see
by the orange light ring these devices
are instead of mode your Amazon echo is
ready for setup the first time you open
the device setup tool you will input
your IAM credentials we created before
this then click discover devices all
devices in setup mode close to you will
populate in this window you can identify
the devices by the last three digits of
their DSN s you may choose to provision
just one or many at a time in this case
we will select all of them next we must
choose which Wi-Fi network to assign our
devices to after that it's just a simple
click to begin the process these devices
will be provisioned over the next few
minutes
note that your machine will lose
Internet access during this process
great as you can see all of our devices
were successfully provisioned to confirm
this just asked a question
Alexa what time is it the time and time
it looks I know C a.m. I'll put them on
mute so they don't wake up
now we can return to where we started
and find all of these devices in our AWS
HQ console ready for deployment and
we're done in this video we learned how
to download the device setup tool create
iam credentials prepare and organize
your devices for setup and where to find
them in the console once provisioned
thanks for watching
[Music]
you
